User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:7.0a2) Gecko/20110715 Firefox/7.0a2
Build ID: 20110715042002

Steps to reproduce:

New firefox version is available (on the aurora channel).


Actual results:

When a new version of firefox is available, a small popup containing a link is shown above the windows system tray. The popup is quite small and not very noticeable, and it disappears so quickly, I have never been able to move the mouse cursor quick enough (using a trackpad) to be able to click the link.

I'm currently on the aurora channel, and therefore notice this issue a lot more than normally.


Expected results:

The popup should be displayed longer (maybe 10s). Maybe the popup could be made larger/more noticeable. Or maybe even display an icon in the system tray, once the popup disappeared.

Confirming this, as the update notification is clearly not shown long enough for users to go to it with their mouse in a timely manner. My suggestion would also be that the notification doesn't hide away when the mouse hovers over it.
